title: More Commands
---

## find

- Typicall used to find a file or directory.

- Recall grep is typically used to find patterns inside files
    
- Examples:

```
find . -name "test1.txt"
```

## &&, ||, and ;

- use `&&`, `||` and `;` to chain commands together

- command before `&&` must complete without error for command after `&&` to execute

- command before `||` must result in an error for command after `||` to execute

- use ; to just separate two commands on the same line

```
echo "hi" > test.txt && echo "hello.txt"
find . --name "test1.txt" && echo ok        # error example
find . -name "test1.txt" && echo ok         # no error

find . --name "test1.txt" || echo error        # error example
find . -name "test1.txt" || echo error        # no error
```
